intro: Neoachmandra leucocarpa, commonly known as the white-fruited neoachmandra, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. Its fruit is a schizocarp, splitting into two one-seeded parts when mature. Neoachmandra leucocarpa is typically found in moist, shaded habitats such as forest understories and along stream banks.
